fictionBooks.title: WHERE THE CRAWDADS SING
fictionBooks.author: Delia Owens
fictionBooks.description: In a quiet town on the North Carolina coast in 1969, a young woman who survived alone in the marsh becomes a murder suspect.

fictionBooks.title: THE VANISHING HALF
fictionBooks.author: Brit Bennett
fictionBooks.description: The lives of twin sisters who run away from a Southern Black community at age 16 diverge as one returns and the other takes on a different racial identity but their fates intertwine.

fictionBooks.title: A PRIVATE CATHEDRAL
fictionBooks.author: James Lee Burke
fictionBooks.description: The 23rd book in the Dave Robicheaux series. Rival Louisiana crime families and a time-traveling superhuman assassin bring up Robicheaux’s personal demons.

fictionBooks.title: 1ST CASE
fictionBooks.author: James Patterson and Chris Tebbetts
fictionBooks.description: After getting kicked out of M.I.T., Angela Hoot interns with the F.B.I. and tracks the murderous siblings known as the Poet and the Engineer.

fictionBooks.title: THE ORDER
fictionBooks.author: Daniel Silva
fictionBooks.description: The 20th book in the Gabriel Allon series. The art restorer and spy cuts his family’s vacation short to investigate whether Pope Paul VII was murdered.

fictionBooks.title: CHOPPY WATER
fictionBooks.author: Stuart Woods
fictionBooks.description: The 54th book in the Stone Barrington series. Things get rough for Stone as he goes after criminals in New York City and Key West.

fictionBooks.title: 28 SUMMERS
fictionBooks.author: Elin Hilderbrand
fictionBooks.description: A relationship that started in 1993 between Mallory Blessing and Jake McCloud comes to light while she is on her deathbed and his wife runs for president.

fictionBooks.title: THE GUEST LIST
fictionBooks.author: Lucy Foley
fictionBooks.description: A wedding between a TV star and a magazine publisher on an island off the coast of Ireland turns deadly.

fictionBooks.title: NEAR DARK
fictionBooks.author: Brad Thor
fictionBooks.description: The 19th book in the Scot Harvath series. With a bounty on his head, Harvath makes an alliance with a Norwegian intelligence operative.

fictionBooks.title: AMERICAN DIRT
fictionBooks.author: Jeanine Cummins
fictionBooks.description: A bookseller flees Mexico for the United States with her son while pursued by the head of a drug cartel.

fictionBooks.title: MEXICAN GOTHIC
fictionBooks.author: Silvia Moreno-Garcia
fictionBooks.description: In 1950s Mexico, a debutante travels to a distant mansion where family secrets of a faded mining empire have been kept hidden.

fictionBooks.title: CAMINO WINDS
fictionBooks.author: John Grisham
fictionBooks.description: The line between fact and fiction becomes blurred when an author of thrillers is found dead after a hurricane hits Camino Island.

fictionBooks.title: THE SILENT PATIENT
fictionBooks.author: Alex Michaelides
fictionBooks.description: Theo Faber looks into the mystery of a famous painter who stops speaking after shooting her husband.

fictionBooks.title: IF IT BLEEDS
fictionBooks.author: Stephen King
fictionBooks.description: Four novellas: “Mr. Harrigan’s Phone,” “The Life of Chuck,” “Rat” and “If It Bleeds.”

fictionBooks.title: LUSTER
fictionBooks.author: Raven Leilani
fictionBooks.description: A young Brooklyn artist is invited to live with a New Jersey couple who have an open marriage and an adopted daughter.

nonFictionBooks.title: LIVE FREE OR DIE
nonFictionBooks.author: Sean Hannity
nonFictionBooks.description: The Fox News host offers his assessment on what is at stake in the 2020 election.

nonFictionBooks.title: TOO MUCH AND NEVER ENOUGH
nonFictionBooks.author: Mary L Trump
nonFictionBooks.description: The clinical psychologist gives her assessment of events and patterns inside her family and how they shaped President Trump.

nonFictionBooks.title: CASTE
nonFictionBooks.author: Isabel Wilkerson
nonFictionBooks.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist examines aspects of caste systems across civilizations and reveals a rigid hierarchy in America today.

nonFictionBooks.title: FINDING FREEDOM
nonFictionBooks.author: Omid Scobie and Carolyn Durand
nonFictionBooks.description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex’s journey from courtship to their decision to step away from their royal lives.

nonFictionBooks.title: HOW TO BE AN ANTIRACIST
nonFictionBooks.author: Ibram X Kendi
nonFictionBooks.description: A primer for creating a more just and equitable society through identifying and opposing racism.

nonFictionBooks.title: UNTAMED
nonFictionBooks.author: Glennon Doyle
nonFictionBooks.description: The activist and public speaker describes her journey of listening to her inner voice.

nonFictionBooks.title: EVIL GENIUSES
nonFictionBooks.author: Kurt Andersen
nonFictionBooks.description: The author of “Fantasyland” looks at the economic, cultural and political forces to which he ascribes the undermining and dismantling of the American middle class.

nonFictionBooks.title: THE ANSWER IS ...
nonFictionBooks.author: Alex Trebek
nonFictionBooks.description: Who is the Canadian-American game show host whose pronunciation of the word “genre” has been shared widely on social media?

nonFictionBooks.title: BECOMING
nonFictionBooks.author: Michelle Obama
nonFictionBooks.description: The former first lady describes how she balanced work, family and her husband’s political ascent.

nonFictionBooks.title: EDUCATED
nonFictionBooks.author: Tara Westover
nonFictionBooks.description: The daughter of survivalists, who is kept out of school, educates herself enough to leave home for university.

nonFictionBooks.title: BETWEEN THE WORLD AND ME
nonFictionBooks.author: Ta-Nehisi Coates
nonFictionBooks.description: Winner of the 2015 National Book Award for nonfiction. A meditation on race in America as well as a personal story, framed as a letter to the author's teenage son.

nonFictionBooks.title: THE SPLENDID AND THE VILE
nonFictionBooks.author: Erik Larson
nonFictionBooks.description: An examination of the leadership of the prime minister Winston Churchill.

nonFictionBooks.title: BLITZ
nonFictionBooks.author: David Horowitz
nonFictionBooks.description: The author of “Big Agenda” explains why he thinks President Trump will be re-elected.

nonFictionBooks.title: THE ROOM WHERE IT HAPPENED
nonFictionBooks.author: John Bolton
nonFictionBooks.description: The former national security advisor gives his account of the 17 months he spent working for President Trump.

nonFictionBooks.title: BREATH
nonFictionBooks.author: James Nestor
nonFictionBooks.description: A re-examination of a basic biological function and a look at the science behind ancient breathing practices.

personalBookList.title: WHERE THE CRAWDADS SING
personalBookList.author: Delia Owens
personalBookList.description: In a quiet town on the North Carolina coast in 1969, a young woman who survived alone in the marsh becomes a murder suspect.
